events.originalText: Contaminated beer served at a funeral in Tete Province, Mozambique, killed 75 people and made at least 230 others ill.
events.subtitle: Mozambique funeral beer poisoning
events.headline: Contaminated beer kills 75 at funeral in Tete Province, Mozambique

events.originalText: In poor weather conditions, Iran Air Flight 277 (plane pictured) crashed near Urmia Airport, Iran, killing 78 of the 105 people on board.
events.subtitle: Iran Air Flight 277
events.headline: Iran Air Flight 277 crashes near Urmia Airport, Iran, killing 78

events.originalText: First Chechen War: Chechen separatists launched raids in the city of Kizlyar, Dagestan, which turned into a massive hostage crisis involving thousands of civilians.
events.subtitle: First Chechen War
events.headline: Chechen separatists launch raids in Kizlyar, Dagestan, leading to massive hostage crisis

events.originalText: Radio astronomers Aleksander Wolszczan and Dale Frail announced the discovery of two pulsar planets orbiting PSR B1257+12 (depicted), the first confirmed detection of exoplanets.
events.subtitle: Aleksander Wolszczan
events.headline: Astronomers discover two pulsar planets orbiting PSR B1257+12

events.originalText: Representatives from the United States and Iraq met at the Geneva Peace Conference to find a peaceful resolution to the Iraqi invasion of Kuwait.
events.subtitle: Geneva Peace Conference (1991)
events.headline: US and Iraq meet at Geneva Peace Conference to resolve Iraqi invasion of Kuwait

events.originalText: U.S. representative Raymond Lederer was convicted of bribery and conspiracy for his role in the Abscam scandal, but continued to serve his term for three more months.
events.subtitle: Raymond Lederer
events.headline: US representative Raymond Lederer convicted in Abscam scandal

events.originalText: Iranian Revolution: Protests took place in Qom after an article insulting Ruhollah Khomeini was published.
events.subtitle: Iranian Revolution
events.headline: Protests in Qom after insulting article about Ruhollah Khomeini

events.originalText: In Central and Southeastern United States, a Great Storm formed the first of forty-five tornadoes over a three-day period.
events.subtitle: Central United States
events.headline: Great Storm spawns forty-five tornadoes in Central and Southeastern US

events.originalText: Seawise University, formerly RMS Queen Elizabeth, an ocean liner that sailed the Atlantic for Cunard Line, caught fire in Victoria Harbour, Hong Kong.
events.subtitle: RMS Queen Elizabeth
events.headline: Seawise University catches fire in Victoria Harbour, Hong Kong

events.originalText: The Los Angeles Lakers of the National Basketball Association lost to the Milwaukee Bucks, ending a 33-game winning streak, the longest in major American professional team sports.
events.subtitle: Los Angeles Lakers
events.headline: Los Angeles Lakers' 33-game winning streak ends with loss to Milwaukee Bucks

events.originalText: The Presidential Council for Minority Rights, an appointed body to review legislation and prevent discrimination against minorities, was created in Singapore.
events.subtitle: Presidential Council for Minority Rights
events.headline: Presidential Council for Minority Rights created in Singapore

events.originalText: First World War: Troops of the British Empire defeated Ottoman forces at the Battle of Rafa on the Sinai–Palestine border in present-day Rafah.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: British Empire troops defeat Ottoman forces at Battle of Rafa

events.originalText: An earthquake registering 7.9 Mw ruptured part of the San Andreas Fault in central and southern California.
events.subtitle: 1857 Fort Tejon earthquake
events.headline: 7.9 Mw earthquake ruptures San Andreas Fault in California

events.originalText: War of the First Coalition: The siege of Kehl by Habsburg and Württembergian forces ended when French troops withdrew from their fortifications.
events.subtitle: War of the First Coalition
events.headline: Siege of Kehl ends as French troops withdraw from fortifications
